revised_title: The Role of Generalist Pollinators in the Reproductive Success of Aldabran Plants
tldr: This study examines the role of unspecialized pollinators, particularly beetles, in the reproductive success of Aldabran plants. The Aldabra atoll has a diverse but small flora, making it an ideal location to study plant-pollinator interactions. The research found that while specialized pollinator-plant relationships are rare, generalist pollinators like beetles and birds play a significant role in the reproductive success of Aldabran plants. Beetles, specifically Mausoleopsis aldabrensis, were observed visiting 58% of the plant species observed in flower on Aldabra, making them efficient pollen transfer agents.
